sect1.title: ItemCmdletProvider
sect1.para: The ItemCmdletProvider supports items referred to by path names. This provider does not distinguish between container-like items (HDF5 groups) and leaf items. It also has no concept of navigation. Items can retrieved, cleared, or invoked, i.e., a default action performed.
The following HDF5 entities are treated as PowerShell items by PSH5X:

sect2.para: The Get-Item cmdlet gets the item at the specified location. It does support multiple path names and the wildcard character '*' to retrieve all matching items. This cmdlet does not retrieve the content of an item, such as the value of an HDF5 dataset.
The -Detailed switch can be used to retrieve additional information about an item.

example.title: Retrieving the root group of the HDF5 scratch PSDrive
example.screen:
PS:1 > Get-Item h5tmp:\ | Format-List
PSPath : HDF5\HDF5::h5tmp:\ PSParentPath : PSChildName : h5tmp: PSDrive : h5tmp PSProvider : HDF5\HDF5 PSIsContainer : True LinkCount : 7 Timestamps : {ModificationTime, AccessTime, ChangeTime, BirthTime} AttributeNames : {attr1} AttributeCount : 1 ItemType : Group

example.screen:

sect2.title: Clear-Item
sect2.para: The Clear-Item cmdlet deletes the value of an item, but it does not delete the item.

Changes the value of an item to the value specified in the command. The behavior of the cmdlet depends on the type of the item referred to by -Path. Currently, the following kinds of items are supported:

listitem.para: If present, the -Value argument must be a .NET array of a type that can be converted into the dataset's HDF5 datatype.

If the dataset is not extendible, the shape of the array provided in -Value must match the shape of the dataset (rank and extent). The -Shape argument would have no effect in this case and will generate an error.

If the dataset is extendible, its value and/or shape will be changed if, and only if, either of the -Force switch or the -Shape argument, but not both, are present. With the -Force switch present, the cmdlet will infer the new shape of the dataset from the -Value argument. If the -Shape argument is specified, the -Value argument must either be absent, in which case only the shape of the dataset will be updated, or it must be a one-dimensional .NET array.
The -Value argument must be convertible to a string. The -Shape argument has no effect in this case and will generate a warning.

The -Value argument must be convertible into a string array of length 2. The first element is used to initialize the external link's file name and the second argument used as the HDF5 path name. The -Shape argument has no effect in this case and will generate a warning.

sect2.title: Invoke-Item
sect2.para: The Invoke-Item cmdlet performs the default action on the specified item.
